result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Serena Hope Johnson

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Serena Hope Johnson in court.  Attorney Lucas Daniel Wilson in court for Serena Hope Johnson. Atty Wilson requests to set a plea in 2023. OFF RECORD  for scheduling. Court confirms address. ON RECORD: 9:02 am Atty Wilson informs the court that def has completed Rule 25 and some follow up. A resolution is close at this time and an agreement is expected.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 18, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Rule 25 Assessment. Filed by Atty Wilson. km        to ty

Adjustment Number: 22A 055308,
Payable Number: 241405,
Receipt Number: 22R 007653,
Amount: $20.00

Settlement conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Follows through with obtaining a Rule 25 by Friday, June 10, 2022

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Intern Connor Smith and   Holly Elkin Rockow  DF ATTY:  Lucas Daniel Wilson appears via zoom   DF:  Serena Hope Johnson appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Wilson waives further reading and time limits. Requesting preliminary hearing. Argues cash bond. DE is looking into treatment. Intends on getting Rule 25. Court sets bond. Directs Atty Wilson if DE can not obtain Rule 25 by next Friday to file a letter with the court.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty Wilson requesting zoom permission. Approved by RMW. hml
